review_title: Amazing people, great pay, nice benefits
job_title: Remote Medical Interpreter in Lowell, MA
pros: Great team, very encouraging, the pay is above average, and the benefits a pretty decent. They will always help you out, no matter what. They listen to your problems and work with you. They take criticism and get better all the time. It's amazing, really.
cons: None, really. I recommend them without reservations!

pros: great for networking and engaging with your community, also has convenient parking.
cons: No room for growth unfortunatley

pros: Great vacation and sick time. You see a wide array of problems
cons: Poor work life balance Poor management

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Assistant in Lowell, MA
pros: Being a part of this non profit organization that focuses on the medically underserved population and refugees entering the country gives meaning and purpose to any position at the health center.
cons: There is only one Clinical Lab Supervisor and Clinical Lab Assistant and 6 different departments each with their own labs on 5 different floors with 60+ clinical staff members not counting providers that make various regular requests throughout the day, everyday. We need a team of more than just the two of us.

job_title: IT Support Engineer in Lowell, MA
pros: Flexible hour Hybrid working Generous Time off
cons: Co-pay parking Lack of opportunity to growth within Below average pay

pros: Learn a lot and fast paced
cons: Need little more educational training

review_title: Management terrible, co workers and patients great
pros: Fellow nurses were extremely helpful and worked together as a team.
cons: Management had no self awareness of their inabilities to build a working relationship with their staff. Extremely sexist  and  an absolute disgusting example of management in any field.

pros: Friendly employees, very caring and enthusiastic.  Focus on southeastern asian populations, very diverse.  You are able to explore different cultural in this department.  Specially Tuesday, a day set and focus on newly arrived refugees.
cons:
1. Lack of space for MA's: we are currently sitting in the soil room.  Upper management close there eyes, and ears when walking past us.  We are still fighting for our voice to be heard.

2.  There's a disconnect between employees and upper management.  Lack of understanding, appreciation, ignore concerns, no trust and listens with resistance.

3. Under paid, over work.  ( every year you get a piece of paper attached to your pay check, asking you to donate to the health center)
At the end of the day, you need to sign yourself up for behavior health.

review_title: Great experience working with all different cultures.
pros: I felt that the staff at Lowell Community Health Center really wanted to make changes in the community and better the health and safety of the center's patients.  There was a strong spirit of wanting to reach out and help the under served people in the area.
cons: Often, I did feel that management under appreciated the work that the employees in their department were accomplishing every day for not much pay. This does happen everywhere but people working in community centers are really there for more altruistic reasons and should be treated as such.

review_title: Good mission, lacking in good management
job_title: Community Health Worker in Lowell, MA
pros: The community, the coworkers, the united mission
cons: Low pay, management is very detached from employees. Communication is very poor. Extremely high turn over rate.

review_title: Work for a mission...some of us
pros: Good patients. Good mission.  Good CEO. Nice building with growing number of specialists
cons: Not focused on patient care. Poor compensation. Focus on bottom line. Poor workflows. Increased administrative burden. EMR not synced with hospitals or specialist in network. High staff turnover. Lots of new providers nurses and MAs

review_title: Great experience for someone interested in community health, amazing connections and services

pros: Comprehensive community health center that serve patients in multiple languages.  Great way to get involved in community health.
cons: Most positions require some nights and weekends.  Does not pay as well as some jobs in Boston MA

pros: coworkers and very beautiful building
